definition: to close shop in the evening/also pr. [da3 yang2]
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Until 3a. m. , the shop closed, I have gone too.
sentences.chinese: 到了凌晨3点，店打烊了，我们也该走了。

sentences.english: After locking up one night I and the other bar manager were cleaning up.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上打烊后，我和朋友开始打扫酒吧。

sentences.english: And the Arab stands in front of my telling me that he is going to close.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人正站在我面前，告诉我他要打烊了。

sentences.english: The manager gave the store a final check-up before closing for the night.
sentences.chinese: 经理在晚上打烊前对商店做了最后检查。

sentences.english: The dishwashers always closed down the dining hall.
sentences.chinese: 洗碗工经常要负责给餐厅打烊。

sentences.english: because they were finishing up and they didn't want to carry everything.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们打烊了，而且他们不想带走所有的东西。

sentences.english: Even a Starbucks on Madison Avenue didn't open.
sentences.chinese: 麦迪逊小道上标志性的星巴克都罕有地打烊收歇。

sentences.english: Excuse me, but when does the Chinese Restaurant close?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，请问中餐厅什么时候打烊？

sentences.english: That means it's time to go. The store is about to close.
sentences.chinese: 意思是要我们离开了，店快打烊了。

sentences.english: Closing time is up, they need to checkout before you pay.
sentences.chinese: 打烊时间已到，需要先结帐，先帮您买单。

sentences.english: At night, the chrysalises light up, to keep people's dreams forever illuminated.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚蝶蛹幻化成灯，好让梦想永不打烊。

sentences.english: EG: Excuse me, when does your Chinese Restaurant close?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，请问中餐厅什么时候打烊？

sentences.english: I closed for clean up and called a repair man.
sentences.chinese: 我打烊清理卫生，也打电话叫了人来修理机器。

sentences.english: Pub after closing time, and gave the jade lute eight ocean for wages.
sentences.chinese: 酒馆打烊后，翩翩给了玉琴八个大洋作工钱。

sentences.english: The shopkeeper gave his store a final checkup before closing for the night.
sentences.chinese: 店主在晚上打烊前对商店作了最后检查。

definition: to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to have a full house/to be sold out/no vacancy
to finish work/to get off work
(of a theater) to empty/(of a show) to end
